messages.message:
:loudspeaker: PSA - we have been facing issues with expiration of the JIRA API credentials use for vulnerability automation that has caused release scans to fail across multiple runs over the last week. We are working with IT to find a permanent fix to restore the credentials. For further details we are posting updates in <#C05TZK5EEJE|>

For now to mitigate the problem we are going to use personal JIRA API creds to run the automation and generate the vulnerability reports. As a result you will see some of the automation updates come through from Shikhar's JIRA account. The release scanner for today has run. For any questions please use the channel above. cc @Parvez
Sudeep we had reissued the service account on Tuesday is there an issue with it?  We'd prefer to avoid personal credentials being used if possible.

@Dave yes, it seems that the new creds are missing required perms (https://instabase.slack.com/archives/C05TZK5EEJE/p1695972214975999) at this point. We are discussing this further with Derrick in the channel above.
They were matched to the last set, can @Parvez confirm what access is missing?
let's discuss this in the incident channel above? i have asked Parvez to confirm as well there
